context_of_use: This use case allows customers to add products to their cart and complete the checkout process to create an order.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to purchase multiple items conveniently
description: This use case enables customers to add products to their cart and complete the checkout process to create an order.
preconditions: Customer is logged into the system.
Customer has selected products to purchase.
assumptions: The customer has a valid account.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
The system shall enable customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
main_flow: 1. Customer browses products → System displays product categories.
2. Customer adds products to cart → System updates the cart with selected products.
3. Customer proceeds to checkout → System displays checkout options.
4. Customer selects payment method → System processes the payment.
5. Customer confirms order → System creates the order and sends confirmation.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 3): Customer decides to apply a discount code → System validates the discount code and updates the total amount.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 4): Payment processing fails → System notifies the customer and prompts for a different payment method.
